paper_abstract: A multi-level repulsive-force out-of-plane microelectrostatic actuator is proposed in this paper. The actuator uses a repulsive force instead of an attractive force and thus avoids the "pull-in" effect associated with conventional parallel-plate microelectrostatic actuators. The multi-level repulsive-force actuator is modelled, and the performance of an example design of the actuator is presented through numerical simulations. Simulation results show that the multi-level actuator can output a stroke much larger than that of a two-layer repulsive-force actuator when subject to the same voltage.
paper_title: Performance assessment of a multi-level repulsive-force out-of-plane microelectrostatic actuator
